resources.string: Welcome to Steema\'s TeeChart Android Preview
TeeChart for Android Preview

Steema Software has been providing developers with tools for charting since 1995. The TeeChart for Android Library forms part of ongoing development to make available for Android application development all of the charting features that form part of the TeeChart Libraries. This preview application shows a few of the possibilities available to developers.

The Pie style shows values displayed as slices of a cheese or pie. Options include 2D and 3D, moving the slices, marks, patterns, ellipse shape, border, shadow, grouping of small values, partial pies, multiple pies, etc.

Line series displays points drawing one line from each point to the next. Options include 2D and 3D, "stairs" mode, null points, pointers, border, filling pattern, height 3D, stacking, overlaping, clicking, dark 3D and marks.

The Bar style allows single or multiple bars, with different layouts ( 3D, side-to-side, side-all, stacked, stacked 100% ). Options include 2D and 3D, color-each-bar, bar style, patterns, dark 3D, bottom origin, auto-mark positions, stacking groups, marks, border, etc.

The Area style allows single or multiple areas, with different layouts ( 3D, overlap, stacked, stacked 100% ). Options include 2D and 3D, color-each-area, patterns, gradients, dark 3D, bottom origin, stairs mode, marks, border, transparency, etc.
Point series displays XY values using a Pointer. Each pointer has many different methods, like color, 3D, shadow, style, marks, pattern, border, width, height, etc.

Candle (OHLC) series displays financial data in several ways (Candle, Bar and Stick). Candle colors are determined by the Open and Close values. Weekend data can be removed using a sequential index for the X value. Configuration options include border, draw 3D, open and close colors, candle style, marks, etc. Candle charts are the base for financial functions (RSI, etc).
urface displays a grid of XYZ floating point values. Options include palette, border, pattern, null values, wire-frame, dots, surface sides, marks, gradients, inverted axes, etc.
Tower series displays bars in 3D grid mode. Several methods configure the aspect and size of each bar.

The Contour Series displays lines corresponding to "Level" values on 3D XYZ data. The number of levels, the level intervals, the levels positions, colors and Legend can be fully customized. It can also be viewed in 2D, or rotated in 3D mode.
ColorGrid series is a 2D surface. Each "cell" has a value and an optional color. The add method is used to fill the color grid. An optional "grid" over cells is displayed using the Pen method.
Polar and radar series now support null points (controlled via the TreatNulls property). Uncheck the "Hide null points" checkbox to see the difference between "normal" and "null" style(s).
Smith Series is a chart style to draw Smith charts. Each point is defined with Resistance and Reactance values. It inherits most common methods from Polar and Circled ancestor series.

The Fast-Line chart style is, at it\'s name implies, the fastest way to plot many points. It simply draws a thin line connecting all points. Some optimizations (like not drawing repeated values) are performed. It can be used in real-time applications to plot new added points.
Polar and radar series now support null points (controlled via the TreatNulls property). Uncheck the "Hide null points" checkbox to see the difference between "normal" and "null" style(s).
Surface displays a grid of XYZ floating point values. Options include palette, border, pattern, null values, wire-frame, dots, surface sides, marks, gradients, inverted axes, etc.

The Area style allows single or multiple areas with different layouts ( 3D, overlap, stacked, stacked 100% ). Options include 2D and 3D, color-each-area, patterns, gradients, dark 3D, bottom origin, stairs mode, marks, border, transparency, etc.
CircularGauge series may be used to dial display data.
LinearGauge series may be used to display data with high frequency changes.
Map series now has a new transparency property.
High-Low series draws (and optionally fills) two lines with High and Low values for each point.
